page.title: 05 FLETCHER FOLD SCHOOL
page.content: Fletcher Fold School is a special school for the{handicapped.}There are six classrooms, and eight children in each of them. There are forty-eight children in the whole school. The handicaps are{blindness, deafness, {spasticity,}and some of the children cannot walk. Fletcher Fold is different from an ordinary school, and the subjects the children do differ because of their handicap. Some of the doors are big because of wheelchairs. The school was built in 1976 and took two years to build. There are seven teachers,( six ladies and one man ).
